intro: Neocussonia capuroniana, commonly known as the African starwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Neocussonia capuroniana is typically found in woodland and forested areas, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
